info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 8:06PM MST until July 31 at 11:15PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Mohave County in northwestern Arizona... * Until 1115 PM MST. * At 806 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chloride, Golden Valley, Windy Point Campground, Packsaddle Campground and New Kingman-Butler. This includes the following roads... State Route 68 in Mohave County between mile markers 16 and 27. Oatman Highway between mile markers 37 and 44. Stockton Hill Road between mile markers 8 and 29. Highway 93 in Mohave County between mile markers 53 and 66. This includes the following streams and drainages... Sacramento Wash, Secret Pass Wash, Cane Spring Wash, Tennessee Wash, Meadow Creek, Thirteenmile Wash, Cerbat Wash, Griffith Wash, Truxton Wash, Detrital Wash and Hualapai Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
